p: The depletion of crude oil resources has encouraged research on the production of renewable fuels such as biodiesel [18, 19] which can be obtained from renewable sources such as edible vegetable oils, inedible oils, and animal fats [20] through catalytic triglyceride transesterification and free fatty acid esterification and offers the advantages of renewability, reduction of greenhouse gas emissions, biodegradability, and non-toxicity [21, 22, 23, 24].
